question.title: WSO2 fails to start on Windows with "Could not resolve module" error
question.body:
I'm trying to run WSO2 Identity Server (or any WSO2 Carbon product) on Windows 11, but I'm getting an OSGi bundle resolution error immediately when starting the server.

ERROR : FrameworkEvent ERROR
[Events.Framework] ERROR : FrameworkEvent ERROR  
org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Could not resolve module: org.wso2.carbon.identity.oauth2.grant.jwt [462]  
  Unresolved requirement: Import-Package: org.wso2.carbon.core.util; version="[4.4.0,5.0.0)"

answers.body:
The error occurs when my WSO2 installation path contains space,WSO2 Carbon framework has problems handling file paths with spaces on Windows systems.

Solution

  • Move Installation to Path Without Spaces C:\tools\wso2am-4.5.0.23\
  • Use Short Path Names cmd /c 'dir /x "C:\Program Files"' then you can run from current problématique path like so: C:\PROGRA~1\wso2is-5.11.0\bin> api-manager.bat
